volunteer_experiences.description:
The Nehemiah Project as “a group of well-meaning individuals who are committed to rebuilding the society by empowering and inspiring the youths as the future leaders of our country: to discover, explore and realize their full potential.”

NYEI partners with Growing Business Foundation (GBF), Nigeria's leading not for profit organization that tackles poverty through providing capacity building, access to market and finance to people at the bottom of the economic pyramid (BOP).

One of our projects, 'THE NEHEMIAH PROJECT KADUNA: I AM NIGERIA was aimed at taking youths between the ages of 18-28 years old, who are struggling in the poverty bracket, who may be homeless, unemployed and/or in jobs that hold no interest to them, that have natural affinity to farming or a desire to learn and provide them with sustainable skills and tools that will set them well on their way to becoming successful entrepreneurs within 3 years.

The project also helped to showcase Kaduna as a cross section of what Nigeria is and our youths can be in terms of potential, capability, capacity, ingenuity, tolerance, passion, drive and entrepreneurial spirit. 

The project, still running, shows that despite what some may wish to believe and irrespective of the picture being crafted and presented to the nation and world at large, the majority of Nigerians and especially the people of Kaduna will co-exist in peace, are concerned about the same basic drivers as food, shelter and economic well-being. That Nigerians, irrespective of tribe, tongue, gender or religion are ready to work hard and are able and willing to fend for themselves giving the right opportunities and enabling environment.

We were able to communicate the oneness in spirit of the nation and the benefit of working in unity, peace and harmony. Kaduna becomes the launch pad for healing a nation in dire need of a common national identity.
